CPAS_EXPLAIN.centers_text: The main CPAS office of a given commune. What it does: receives applications, issues official decisions on eligibility, arranges payments, housing/health-insurance support, and provides certificates. It is the legal point of reference and the primary address for your commune.
CPAS_EXPLAIN.antennas_text: Neighborhood intake points of the same CPAS, closer to where you live (local/quarter offices). What they do: first reception, guidance, document collection, social assessment, and follow-up. The formal decision is still taken by your commune’s CPAS center.

WHAT_IS_CPAS: The CPAS/OCMW (Public Center for Social Welfare) is a municipal service in Belgium that supports people in need. It provides social, financial, medical, or material assistance depending on the individual's situation. On this page, you can find the CPAS/OCMW responsible for your area by using the postal code or the street where you live.
WHAT_IS_ACTIRIS: Actiris is the public employment service for the Brussels‑Capital Region. It supports jobseekers with registration, job matching, training, career guidance and employer programmes. On this page you can find your local Actiris office by commune/postcode or by the street where you live.
WHAT_IS_VDAB: VDAB (Flemish Service for Employment and Vocational Training) is the official employment service for Flanders and Dutch‑speaking residents of Brussels. It offers jobs, training, career advice and reskilling programmes. On this page you can find the appropriate VDAB office by region using your postcode or the street where you live.

NEW_INCOMER.title: Step-by-step Guide for Newcomers in Belgium
NEW_INCOMER.description: This guide will help you understand what to do when you arrive in Belgium.

STEP_1.title: Obtain Protection in Belgium
STEP_1.description: Go to the registration centre in Brussels at Rue Belliard 68, 1000 Brussels. The centre is open from Monday to Friday, with registration starting at 08:30. The number of places is limited, so it is recommended to arrive early in the morning. Here you can apply for temporary protection or refugee status.

STEP_2.title: Find Housing or Stay in Refugee Camp
STEP_2.description: Look for temporary or permanent accommodation. If you have no housing, you may be assigned to a refugee reception centre.

STEP_3.title: Register at the Commune
STEP_3.description: Go to your local commune to register your address, get Annex 15, and apply for the A card.

STEP_4.title: Register at CPAS/OCMW
STEP_4.description: Visit your local CPAS/OCMW to apply for social assistance.

STEP_5.title: Register with Employment Office (Actiris/VDAB)
STEP_5.description: Register at Actiris or VDAB depending on your region to look for work or get jobseeker status.

STEP_6.title: Apply for Social Benefits
STEP_6.description: Once registered at the Commune and CPAS/OCMW, you can apply for social benefits if eligible.

STEP_7.title: Start Language Courses
STEP_7.description: Many regions offer free French or Dutch language courses for migrants.

cpas_list_title: This guide helps you prepare the right documents, find your local CPAS/OCMW, and book your first appointment. Clear, actionable steps explain what to bring, how to contact CPAS/OCMW, typical decision timelines, and what happens next. Start here—everything you need is in one place.

step_1.title: Préparer les documents
step_1.description: Annexe 15, passeport ou carte d’identité, preuve d’adresse (contrat de bail, inscription ou attestation de l’hébergeur), relevés bancaires (1–3 derniers mois), autres documents (preuve de revenus, certificats médicaux le cas échéant).

step_2.title: Choisir le CPAS/OCMW de votre domicile
step_2.description: Trouvez le CPAS/OCMW de votre commune (par code postal ou adresse).

step_3.title: Premier contact
step_3.description: Téléphonez ou envoyez un e-mail. Certains CPAS/OCMW proposent un formulaire de prise de rendez-vous en ligne.

step_4.title: Fixer un rendez-vous
step_4.description: Un rendez-vous avec un(e) assistant(e) social(e) vous sera proposé. Un pré-dépistage téléphonique peut avoir lieu.

step_5.title: Entretien
step_5.description: Apportez tous les documents. Décrivez votre situation : logement, revenus, besoins. L’agent ouvre votre dossier.

step_6.title: Attente de la décision
step_6.description: Le CPAS/OCMW analyse votre dossier (généralement 7 à 30 jours). Il peut vous convoquer à un entretien supplémentaire ou demander des pièces complémentaires.

step_7.title: Obtention de l’aide
step_7.description: Si avis favorable : aide sociale, soutien au logement, assurance maladie ou cours. En cas de refus — possibilité d’introduire un recours.

LETTER_FORM.LETTER_READY: Your letter is ready to copy

LETTER_STEPPER.TITLE: Compose your letter
LETTER_STEPPER.DESCRIPTION: Enter your details using the Latin alphabet—as in your passport (A–Z). When you’re done, you can copy the generated letter or, if your mail app is set up, open it with everything pre‑filled. Tip: review the preview on the last step before sending.

HOUSE_SEARCH.title: Housing rental
HOUSE_SEARCH.catch_desc: For legalization in Belgium, it is mandatory to have housing. This may be a rented apartment, a room, or social housing.
HOUSE_SEARCH.websites_desc: You can independently search for housing using popular platforms to find apartments, studios, or houses.
